definition[0]: to move around quickly in a twisting circular movement, or to make something do this
example[0]: The river had become a swirling torrent.
example[2]: He swirled the brandy around in his glass.
definition[1]: if stories or ideas swirl around a place, a lot of people start to talk about them â€“ used especially in news reports
example[3]: Rumours of a takeover began to swirl around the stock markets.
definition[2]: a swirling movement or amount of something
